related_standards: IEC 62790:2014 - Junction boxes for PV modules
accreditation_requirements: Solar simulator Class A or better

equipment_requirements: DC power supply or electronic load

sample_requirements.conditioning: Pre-test at STC, identify cells for shading
sample_requirements.traceability: Serial number, cell matrix map, baseline thermal image

standard_test.attachment: Secure to glass surface without damaging module

operating_condition.justification: Isc produces maximum current through shaded cell, worst-case for hot-spot

temperature_range.calibration: Full range calibrated to NIST standards

hotspot_location.documentation: Overlay thermal image on module diagram
hotspot_location.verification: Must correlate with shaded cell position

thermal_distribution.spatial_map: Full module thermal image every 15 minutes
thermal_distribution.temperature_profile: Line scan across shaded and adjacent cells
thermal_distribution.gradient_analysis: Temperature difference between hot spot and surroundings

camera_position.field_of_view: Entire module or focused region of interest

emissivity.note: Set emissivity based on measurement surface

environmental_corrections.reflected_temperature: Measure ambient reflected temperature, input to camera
environmental_corrections.atmospheric_correction: Account for distance and humidity (camera software)

calibration_verification.acceptance: ±2°C or ±2% of reading, whichever is greater

data_acquisition.temporal_resolution: One image per minute during critical periods
data_acquisition.file_format: Radiometric TIFF or camera-native format (preserves temperature data)
data_acquisition.post_processing: Temperature extraction using camera software or Python analysis

pre_test_preparation.acceptance: No damage that would confound hot-spot test

pre_test_preparation.details: Image module under full illumination at Isc, no shading
Use diode test function or forward-bias test
pre_test_preparation.acceptance: All bypass diodes functional, Vf = 0.5-0.7 V at rated current

pre_test_preparation.details: Identify center cell of each substring
pre_test_preparation.documentation: Mark cell coordinates on module diagram

pre_test_preparation.details: Attach opaque shadow to selected cell(s)
pre_test_preparation.verification: 100% coverage, secure attachment, no air gaps

test_execution.details: Mount module in simulator test plane
requirements: Module at normal incidence to light source
Shaded cell visible to thermal camera
Electrical connections to short-circuit or load

test_execution.details: Turn on simulator, verify irradiance and uniformity
Capture thermal image at t=0 (just after illumination)

test_execution.verification: Isc should match baseline (shading affects voltage, not Isc for parallel strings)

test_execution.details: Acquire thermal images at 1-minute intervals for first 15 min, then 15-min intervals
Maintain illumination for 1 hour (or extended duration per test plan)
monitoring: Visual inspection for smoke, arcing, or failure

test_execution.details: After exposure duration, turn off simulator
test_execution.final_image: Capture thermal image at end of exposure
test_execution.cooldown: Allow module to cool for 30 minutes before handling

post_test_evaluation.details: Examine module for damage caused by hot-spot
focus_areas: Discoloration or melting of encapsulant at hot-spot location

post_test_evaluation.details: Carefully remove shadow, inspect for residue or adhesive damage
post_test_evaluation.cleaning: Clean glass surface with isopropyl alcohol if needed

post_test_evaluation.comparison: Compare to baseline, calculate power degradation

post_test_evaluation.details: Image module under full illumination at Isc, no shading
post_test_evaluation.comparison: Compare to baseline thermal image, identify permanent thermal anomalies

post_test_evaluation.details: Verify diode functionality after thermal stress
post_test_evaluation.acceptance: All diodes still functional, no change in Vf

post_test_evaluation.details: Per IEC 61215-2 MQT 01, if hot-spot test is part of full sequence
post_test_evaluation.purpose: Verify no insulation damage from hot-spot

maximum_temperature.note: For EVA-encapsulated modules; other materials may have different limits
maximum_temperature.consequence: Exceeding this limit may cause permanent encapsulant degradation

temperature_stability.condition: Hot-spot temperature must stabilize (change < 2°C per 10 min)
temperature_stability.reason: Indicates thermal equilibrium; runaway heating is a failure

current_continuity.condition: Module must deliver current throughout test
current_continuity.failure_mode: Open-circuit during test indicates catastrophic cell failure

no_major_defects: No backsheet perforation or severe bubbling
minor_defects_acceptable: Slight discoloration of encapsulant at hot-spot (< 2 cm²)
Small bubbles (< 3 mm diameter) if no performance degradation

bypass_diode_function.activation: Bypass diode for shaded substring must activate during test
bypass_diode_function.verification: Measure voltage across substring; should be ~ -Vf (0.5-0.7 V) when diode conducting
bypass_diode_function.post_test: Diode must remain functional after thermal stress

bypass_diode_data.activation_time: Time from illumination to diode conduction
bypass_diode_data.diode_current: Current through bypass diode during test

thermal_camera.verification: Before each test series with reference source

solar_simulator.standard: Reference cell calibrated at accredited lab

repeatability_testing.method: Test same module twice with 24-hour interval

control_module.parameters: Peak hot-spot temperature under standard shading
control_module.trending: Plot results on control chart, investigate any drift

background_subtraction.method: Subtract baseline thermal image from test image
background_subtraction.purpose: Isolate temperature rise due to hot-spot

thresholding.method: Define hot-spot as pixels exceeding threshold

blob_detection.method: Identify connected regions of hot pixels

temperature_transient.purpose: Characterize thermal dynamics, predict long-term behavior

spatial_autocorrelation.purpose: Distinguish localized hot-spot from global heating
spatial_autocorrelation.metric: Moran's I or similar spatial statistic

lamp_replacement.trigger: Irradiance drops below 95% of rated or spectral match degrades
lamp_replacement.procedure: Replace lamps per manufacturer instructions, re-calibrate

reflector_cleaning.method: Dry compressed air or manufacturer-approved cleaner

lens_cleaning.method: Lens tissue and isopropyl alcohol (or manufacturer-approved cleaner)

detector_calibration.verification: Image uniform-temperature blackbody, check for artifacts

firmware_updates.procedure: Follow manufacturer update protocol, verify calibration after update

inspection.checks: No tears, holes, or degradation; opaque to light

monthly_tasks: Full thermal camera calibration with blackbody
Review control module data on control chart
quarterly_tasks: Solar simulator full calibration (spectral match, uniformity, stability)
Review and update hot-spot detection algorithms if needed
annual_tasks: Thermal camera recalibration at accredited laboratory or by manufacturer

immediate_action: Emergency shutdown: turn off simulator immediately
Allow module to cool, do not touch
Document peak temperature, time, and conditions
investigation: Inspect module for damage (melting, charring, cell cracks)
Review test setup: was shading pattern correct? Irradiance level?
Check bypass diode: did it fail to activate?
Perform failure analysis if module damaged
excessive_temperature.reporting: Non-conformance report to engineering and quality teams, notify module manufacturer

bypass_diode_failure.condition: Diode does not activate (substring voltage not at -Vf) or diode open/short
bypass_diode_failure.detection: Voltage measurement during test or pre-test diode check
immediate_action: Do not proceed with hot-spot test if diode non-functional
Document diode failure mode (open, short, high resistance)
bypass_diode_failure.investigation: Determine if diode failure is manufacturing defect or induced by prior test
bypass_diode_failure.corrective_action: Replace module or repair junction box (if allowed by test plan)

simulator_failure.condition: Loss of illumination or irradiance drops >10% during test
immediate_action: Note time of failure and test duration completed
Inspect simulator: lamp failure? Power supply issue?
test_validity: If failure occurred after >90% of test duration: may accept test as valid with documented justification
If failure early in test: repeat test after simulator repair

thermal_camera_malfunction.condition: Camera displays error, frozen image, or obviously incorrect temperatures
immediate_action: Continue test if contact thermocouples are available as backup
Restart camera or replace with backup unit
thermal_camera_malfunction.data_recovery: If camera stores data internally, attempt to recover after test; otherwise rely on contact sensor data

module_catastrophic_failure.condition: Cell cracking, solder bond failure, arcing, or fire during test
immediate_action: EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN - turn off simulator immediately
Evacuate area if fire or toxic fumes
Use CO₂ or dry chemical extinguisher if safe to do so (do not use water on electrical fire)
module_catastrophic_failure.investigation: Full root cause analysis including forensic examination
module_catastrophic_failure.reporting: Immediate notification to safety officer, engineering manager, and module manufacturer

required_documents: Test plan with module ID, shading pattern, and acceptance criteria
Baseline I-V curve and thermal image
Final I-V curve and thermal image
test_record_package.format: Electronic with digital signatures, redundant backup

thermal_data_management.metadata: Embed emissivity, distance, ambient temp in EXIF or sidecar file
thermal_data_management.archiving: Store radiometric originals plus exported PNG for quick review

chain_of_custody.log_entries: Date/time, module S/N, personnel, location, condition notes

data_integrity.checksums: SHA-256 for all image files and data logs
data_integrity.audit_trail: Database logs all access and modifications
data_integrity.backup: Daily automated backup to offsite storage

controls: Interlocks prevent exposure when personnel in test area
UV-blocking safety glasses if entering simulator area

hazards.risk: Burns if touching module during/after test
controls: Thermal gloves if must handle warm module

hazards.risk: Shock from module voltage (up to 1000 V DC)

controls: Fire extinguishers (CO₂ or dry chemical) readily available
Test area free of flammable materials

required_ppe: Safety glasses (UV protection if near simulator)

emergency_procedures.fire: Activate alarm, evacuate, call fire department, use extinguisher only if safe
emergency_procedures.electrical_shock: Do not touch victim if energized, shut off power, call for medical help, administer CPR if trained
emergency_procedures.equipment_failure: Emergency stop button, evacuate if unsafe, notify supervisor

personnel_qualifications: Test technician: High school diploma + 6 months PV testing experience
Test engineer: BS in engineering/physics + 2 years PV experience
All personnel: Thermal imaging certification (Level 1 thermographer) preferred

competency_assessment.initial: Shadow experienced technician for 2 tests, perform 1 test under supervision
competency_assessment.ongoing: Annual refresher on safety and equipment updates

test_optimization: Always perform baseline thermal imaging to identify pre-existing anomalies
Use high-resolution thermal camera (640×480 or better) to resolve individual cell hot spots
Mount camera on tripod for consistent framing across image sequence
Test multiple shading patterns (single cell, partial, multi-cell) to characterize worst-case
common_pitfalls: Incorrect emissivity setting on thermal camera (use 0.90 for glass, not default 0.95)
Reflected temperature not accounted for (simulator lamps reflect off glass, causing false high readings)
Shading material not opaque or not secured (allows light leakage, invalidates test)
Bypass diode not verified before test (non-functional diode leads to excessive hot-spot)

troubleshooting.lower_than_expected_temperature: Check shading is 100% (light leakage cools hot-spot), verify bypass diode activated (if not, less reverse current through shaded cell)
troubleshooting.runaway_heating: Bypass diode may have failed; immediately shut down to prevent module damage
troubleshooting.non_uniform_temperature_across_module: Check simulator uniformity, ensure module is planar and perpendicular to light

advanced_analysis.thermal_time_constant: Fit temperature vs. time to exponential model; τ indicates thermal mass and heat dissipation
advanced_analysis.diode_power_dissipation: Calculate from I × Vf; typical 5-15 W; excessive dissipation may overheat junction box
advanced_analysis.correlation_with_field_failures: Compare lab hot-spot signatures to field-failed modules to validate test severity
